snippet: Emmanuel Tavarez, a former New York City police officer, tried to portray himself as a victim, forced into the robberies by a gang, but he was sentenced to 25 years in prison.
abstract: Former New York City Police Officer Emmanuel Tavarez is sentenced to 25 years in prison for participating in gang robberies of drug dealers; Tavarez had tried to portray himself as a victim who had been forced into joining the robberies, a claim rejected by Judge Sandra L Townes of Federal District Court in Brooklyn.
lead_paragraph: Emmanuel Tavarez, a former New York City police officer, tried to portray himself as a victim, forced into the robberies by a gang, but he was sentenced to 25 years in prison.

headline.seo: Ex-Officer Emmanuel Tavarez Sentenced for Robbing Drug Dealers
headline.main: Ex-Officer Sentenced for Robbing Drug Dealers
headline.print_headline: Ex-Officer Sentenced For Robbing Drug Dealers
